alert.note: Alert for Sanilac; St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 26 at 3:23PM EST until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snow melt continues. * WHERE...St Clair and southern Sanilac Counties * WHEN...Until noon EST Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 317 PM EST, Emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.8 and 1.2 inches of rain fell overnight. This in addition to snow melt had led to rises on area rivers and streams. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Locations along the Black River, especially near and upstream of Jeddo. Mill Creek and other streams in the area are also running high. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
